workflow_rationale: Greenfield project requiring full website implementation from scratch. Building a complete 5-section portfolio website with custom animations, portfolio filtering, and a distinct design system. This follows the standard feature workflow: setup -> design system -> components -> sections -> composition -> integration.

phases.name: Project Setup & Configuration
phases.description: Initialize Next.js 15 project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4, and animation libraries

subtasks.description: Initialize Next.js 15 project with TypeScript and Tailwind
subtasks.notes: Created all Next.js 15 project files manually (npm/npx blocked in sandbox). Files created: package.json, next.config.ts, tsconfig.json, postcss.config.mjs, tailwind.config.ts, next-env.d.ts, eslint.config.mjs, .gitignore, app/layout.tsx, app/page.tsx, app/globals.css. Dependencies: Next.js 15.1.0, React 19.0.0, Tailwind CSS 4.0.0 with @tailwindcss/postcss. User must run `npm install` externally to install dependencies before dev server can start.

subtasks.description: Install animation libraries (Motion and GSAP)
subtasks.notes: Added motion@^11.15.0, gsap@^3.12.5, and @gsap/react@^2.1.1 to package.json dependencies. Committed to git. Note: npm install must be run externally to install packages (sandbox restriction).

subtasks.description: Configure PostCSS for Tailwind CSS v4
patterns_from: Tailwind CSS v4 PostCSS plugin docs

verification.expected: Dev server starts without PostCSS errors

subtasks.notes: PostCSS configuration for Tailwind CSS v4 was already correctly set up in subtask-1-1. The postcss.config.mjs uses @tailwindcss/postcss plugin which is the correct configuration for Tailwind CSS v4. The globals.css has the correct @import 'tailwindcss' syntax. No changes were needed - configuration verified as correct. Note: npm run dev verification cannot be executed due to sandbox restrictions, but configuration follows official Tailwind CSS v4 patterns.

parallel_groups.reason: All depend only on phase-2-design-system, no file conflicts between them

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Parallel phases 3-5 can run concurrently for ~1.3x speedup

acceptance_criteria: Project initializes and runs without errors (npm run dev)
All 5 sections render correctly (Hero, Services, Portfolio, About, Contact)
Dark mossy green color scheme applied consistently
Carbon fiber texture visible in design
Portfolio filtering works for all categories
Hover effects present on interactive elements
TypeScript compiles without errors (npm run build)
verification_strategy.reasoning: Low risk greenfield portfolio website with no sensitive data handling, authentication, or database. Contact form is the only user input. Minimal testing mode appropriate as no security-critical features.

unit_tests.notes: Unit tests optional for low-risk portfolio site. Focus on manual browser verification.
